info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 1:39PM EDT until June 2 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Collier.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have ended. However, rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches have fallen over this area during the last couple of hours from the earlier thunderstorms. This amount of water will take sometime to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Golden Gate Estates, Orangetree, Golden Gate, Vineyards and North Naples. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
